content.webTitle: Sharpe gets go-ahead to reinforce Australia pack

fields.headline: Sharpe gets go-ahead to reinforce Australia pack
fields.bodyText: Nathan Sharpe was passed fit yesterday to lead the Wallaby pack against England tomorrow after a scan showed only minor knee ligament damage. "It was a bit sore but today it feels really good," said the lock, who sustained the injury in training on Wednesday. The panel that cleared the New Zealand lock Ali Williams of deliberately stamping on England's Josh Lewsey has responded to Rugby Football Union calls to explain its decision that contact between Williams' boot and Lewsey's head had been "inadvertent". It had accepted Williams' not guilty plea, said the panel, after concluding his foot had probably been deflected on to Lewsey's head via the forearm of an England player in the ruck. It also heard evidence that Williams had moved forward of Lewsey when the incident occurred, indicating that he had upheld his "duty to take care for the safety of a player on the ground when there is a likelihood of contact with a player's boot while rucking". The conclusion was that "the contact with the head . . . was inadvertent and incidental to Williams' endeavour to ruck the football in a situation where access to it was impeded by the position of English players in the ruck." London Irish have signed the centre Nick Greenstock from Harlequins, who have taken Samoa's wing George Harder from Leeds. Rotherham have recruited the former Swansea and Bridgend prop Christian Loader. Sale's former back-row Apollo Perelini has joined the Sharks' coaching staff. England's A coach Jim Mallinder has made 13 changes for tomorrow's Churchill Cup game against the United States. The seven players who transferred from the tour party in New Zealand were named, along with Phil Greening, back after a hamstring injury. Wales have made one change to the side for tomorrow's Test in New Zealand after the defeat by Australia, the flanker Dafydd Jones replacing Jonathan Thomas. Martyn Williams, the captain, has recovered from ankle trouble. England: Horak; Balshaw, Waters, Johnson, Simpson-Daniel; Barkley, Walshe; Vyvyan (capt), Hazell, Volley, Jones, Palmer, Flatman, Greening, M Worsley. Replacements: Scarbrough, Paul, Wood, Hatley, Cairns, Green, Anglesea. Wales: R Williams; M Jones, Robinson, Taylor, Shanklin; S Jones, Cooper; I Thomas, McBryde, Jenkins, Llewellyn, Sidoli, D Jones, M Williams (capt), Charvis. Replacements: Davies, Evans, Wyatt, J Thomas, Peel, Sweeney, Henson.
